docs.title: List
docs.description: CometChatList contains one to three lines of text optionally flanked by icons or other widgets, such as CometChatAvatar, CometChatDate or Text. CometChatAvatar will always be shown in the leading view therefore either one among the avatarURL or  avatarName must be provided. The icons (or other widgets) for the list item are defined with the tailView parameter. The first line of text is optional and is specified with title. The value of subtitle is also optional, will occupy the space allocated for an additional line of text or some other widget.

docs.title: List Item
docs.description: CometChatListItem contains one to three lines of text optionally flanked by icons or other widgets, such as CometChatAvatar, CometChatDate or Text. CometChatAvatar will always be shown in the leading view therefore either one among the avatarURL or  avatarName must be provided. The icons (or other widgets) for the list item are defined with the tailView parameter. The first line of text is optional and is specified with title. The value of subtitle is also optional, will occupy the space allocated for an additional line of text or some other widget.

docs.title: Action Entity
docs.description: Base class for defining the type of actions that can be performed on BaseInteractiveElement

docs.title: Button Element
docs.description: The ButtonElement class, inherited from the BaseInteractiveElement class, represents an interactive button element that can be added to a chat interface. It comprises of properties like button text and a flag indicating whether the button should be disabled after interaction.

docs.title: Card Bubble
docs.description: The CometChatCardBubble component is used to display a card within a chat bubble. The card includes an image, text, and action buttons. It helps to offer action-oriented chat experiences, like booking a flight, ordering food, scheduling a meeting, etc., directly in the chat.

docs.title: Card Message
docs.description: The CardMessage class is used to create a card message for CometChat. It extends the InteractiveMessage class from CometChat.

docs.title: Checkbox Element
docs.description: The CheckboxElement class aids in creating checkbox input elements in a user interface.

docs.title: SchedulerBubble
docs.description: SchedulerBubble is a versatile type of component designed to facilitate easy and efficient event scheduling. It offers the following key features:

docs.title: Custom Interactive Message
docs.description: The CustomInteractiveMessage class extends CometChat's InteractiveMessage class and represents a custom interactive message that can be sent via CometChat.

docs.title: DateTimePickerElement
docs.description: The DateTimePickerElement class is used to create a Date Picker element in a user interface.

docs.title: DropdownElement
docs.description: The DropdownElement class is used to create a dropdown selection element in a user interface.

docs.title: Element Type
docs.description: This is the base class for every element possible in the Interactive message component, defined by CometChat

docs.title: Form Bubble
docs.description: The CometChatFormBubble component is used to render a form within a chat bubble. The form fields are dynamically built based on the data passed in the message prop. The form fields can include text inputs, checkboxes, radio buttons, dropdown, labels, single selects, buttons. Once the form is filled out and submitted, the data will be sent to the provided URL or handled by a custom function.

docs.title: Form Message
docs.description: The FormMessage class is used to create an interactive form message that can be sent via CometChat. It extends the InteractiveMessage class from CometChat.

docs.title: Label Element
docs.description: The LabelElement class enables the creation of a label element in a user interface.

docs.title: Radio Button Element
docs.description: The RadioButtonElement class is designed to create a radio button input element in a user interface.

docs.title: Scheduler Message
docs.description: The SchedulerMessage class is used to create an interactive scheduler message that can be sent via CometChat. It extends the Interactive Messages class from CometChat.

docs.title: Single Select Element
docs.description: The SingleSelectElement class is utilised to create a single selection input element in a user interface.

docs.title: Text Input Element
docs.description: The TextInputElement class is used to create a text input element in a user interface.

docs.title: Message Information
docs.description: The MessageInformation is a Component designed to display message-related information, such as delivery and read receipts. It serves as an integral part of the CometChat UI UI Kit, extending the List Item class, which provides the underlying infrastructure for CometChat UI components. With its rich set of methods and properties, developers can easily customize and tailor the appearance and behavior of the message information view to suit the specific requirements of their application.

docs.title: Call Buttons
docs.description: This component provides users with the ability to make calls, access call-related functionalities, and control call settings. Clicking this button typically triggers the call to be placed to the desired recipient.

docs.title: Incoming Call
docs.description: The incoming call component is displayed when the user receives an incoming call, such as a voice call, video call. It serves as a visual representation of an incoming call and provides options for the user to answer or decline the call.

docs.title: Integration
docs.description: Integration

docs.title: Ongoing Call
docs.description: This component is displayed during an ongoing voice or video call. This provides a dedicated screen or interface where users can engage in real-time conversation, view video streams, access call controls, and interact with various call-related features.

docs.title: Outgoing Call
docs.description: Overview

docs.title: Contacts
docs.description: CometChatContacts is a standalone UI component specifically designed to facilitate the display and management of users and groups within chat applications. It streamlines the process of showcasing all app users and available chat groups in a user-friendly interface, making it easier for users to connect and communicate effectively.

docs.title: Conversations
docs.description: This component lists the most recent or latest conversations or contacts with whom you have exchanged messages. It provides a convenient way to quickly access and resume conversations with the people you have been in contact with recently.

docs.title: Conversations With Messages
docs.description: This component is responsible for displaying the recent conversation between participants in a 1:1 or group chat. It also allows users to send text, images, videos, or other media as messages to communicate with one another in real-time.

docs.title: Elements
docs.description: Elements is a set of pre-built UI components that act as building blocks of our UI Kit. These UI components are built following the web components standard and using lit library. This allows us to create a framework-agnostic solution so that they can be integrated with our web UIKits such as React, Angular and Vue.

docs.title: Add Members
docs.description: This component allows administrators or group owners to add new members to a specific group. It enables administrators or group owners to extend the membership of a group by adding new users to participate in the group's discussions and activities. By utilising this feature, administrators can manage group membership, and control access to group content.

docs.title: Banned Members
docs.description: This component lists all the users who have been restricted or prohibited from participating in specific groups or conversations. When the user is banned, they are no longer able to access or engage with the content and discussions within the banned group.

docs.title: Group Details
docs.description: CometChatDetails is a component that provides additional information and settings related to a specific group.

docs.title: Group Members
docs.description: This component lists all the users who have been added or invited to participate in a particular group and have access to its discussions, shared content, and collaboration features.

docs.title: Groups
docs.description: This component lists all the groups created on CometChat and also allows users to search for groups. It enables users to find and locate specific groups based on various search criteria or parameters.

docs.title: Groups with Messages
docs.description: This component is responsible for listing all the groups created on CometChat. It also allows group members to send text, images, videos, or other media as messages to communicate with one another in real-time.

docs.title: Transfer Ownership
docs.description: This component allows the current owner or administrator of a group to transfer the ownership rights and administrative control of that group to another user. By transferring ownership, the original owner can designate a new user as the group owner, giving them full control and administrative privileges over the group.

docs.title: CometChat UI Kit
docs.description: CometChatUIKit is a class that contains all necessary methods to help initialise the CometChat SDK with valid credentials for the UI Kit to utilise.

docs.title: Theme
docs.description: Theme class provides endless number of customisations to improve or transform the look and feel of the UI Kit as per your application need. Learn more.

docs.title: Key Concepts
docs.description: CometChat Dashboard

docs.title: Message Composer
docs.description: This component allows users to compose and send messages. It provides a text input area or field where users can enter their messages or responses before sending them to other participants in the conversation.

docs.title: Message Header
docs.description: This component contains relevant information relevant to the chat conversation.

docs.title: Message Information
docs.description: CometChatMessageInformation is a standalone component that displays comprehensive information about the message receipts. This will enable users to easily access details such as the message content, recipient and delivery receipt information for a more informed communication experience.

docs.title: Message List
docs.description: This is a fundamental component of the chat interface that displays a list of chat messages exchanged between participants in a conversation. It serves as a chronological log of the conversation, presenting messages in the order they were sent.

docs.title: Messages
docs.description: This component is responsible for displaying the conversation between participants in a 1:1 or group chat.

docs.title: Threaded Messages
docs.description: This component allows users to organise and group related messages into separate conversations within a larger conversation. It provides a way to maintain context, focus, and clarity when multiple discussions or topics are happening simultaneously within a chat.

docs.description: Using Vue UI Kit, you can integrate your Nuxt.js application with CometChat.

docs.title: Overview
docs.description: CometChat's UI Kit for Vue, you can easily built an chat app with all the essential messaging feature along with the customisations and so on as per your application needs. This UI Kit is a set of prebuilt UI components divided into smaller modules and components and each and every component is configurable to suit your need.

docs.title: Shared
docs.description: This module contains reusable components, utilities, constants, and helper functions that are used across the other CometChat's web UI Kits. Learn more

docs.title: UI Components
docs.description: CometChat's UI Kit is a set of pre-built UI components that allows you to easily craft an in-app chat with all the essential messaging features.

docs.title: Users
docs.description: This component lists all the users registered on CometChat and also allows users to search for other users. It enables users to find and locate specific individuals based on various search criteria or parameters. Online users are represented with a green colored dot.

docs.title: User Details
docs.description: CometChatDetails is a component that provides additional information and settings related to a specific user.

docs.title: Users with Messages
docs.description: This component is responsible for listing all the users registered on CometChat. It also allows users to send text, images, videos, or other media as messages to communicate with one another in real-time.

docs.title: Message Bubble
docs.description: This component is used to visually represent individual messages and display them in a conversation-like format.

docs.title: Tabs
docs.description: This component allows for the organisation and presentation of content or functionality into separate tabs or sections. It provides a way for users to switch between different tabs to access distinct sets of information or perform specific actions.

docs.title: User Member Wrapper
docs.description: The CometChatUserMemberWrapper is a UI component that combines the features of CometChatUsers and CometChatGroupMemberWrapper. It's designed to work behind the scenes in the CometChatMessageComposer to show a simple and smart list of suggestions when users want to mention others in their messages. This makes it easier for users to engage with each other and manage group conversations in a smooth and convenient way.

docs.title: Avatar
docs.description: The CometChatAvatar component displays user and group avatars. For users and groups , it displays either an image or the user's avatar and falls back to the first two letters of the username.

docs.title: Badge
docs.description: The CometChatBadge component displays the unread count of messages for one-to-one private and group chats.

docs.title: Date
docs.description: CometChatDate is a UILabel which is used to show the date and time. It provides various methods to customize the appearance and behavior of the CometChatDate.

docs.title: File Bubble

docs.title: Image Bubble

docs.title: List Base
docs.description: CometChatListBase is a container component having title (navigationBar), search (search-bar), background, and a container to embed a list view, such as CometChatConversationList, CometChatGroupList, CometChatUserList,CometChatCallList.

docs.title: List Item
docs.description: CometChatListItem contains one to three lines of text optionally flanked by icons or other views, such as CometChatAvatar, CometChatDate or Text. CometChatAvatar will always be shown in the leading view therefore either one among the avatarURL or avatarName must be provided. The icons (or other widgets) for the list item are defined with the tailView parameter. The first line of text is optional and is specified with title. The value of subtitle is also optional, will occupy the space allocated for an additional line of text or some other view.

docs.title: Media Recorder
docs.description: CometChatMediaRecorder is a class that allows users to record and send audio messages. It has a start button to start recording, a stop button to stop recording, a play button to play the recorded message, a pause button to pause the recorded message, a submit button to submit the recorded message and a close button to close the media recorder.

docs.title: Status Indicator
docs.description: This component is of the class UImageView. It's customisable to display the status of the user's presence as online, offline using colour codes or can be used to display type of a group as password protected, public or private using a custom image.

docs.title: Text Bubble

docs.description: The ButtonElement class, inherited from the BaseInteractiveElement class, represents an interactive button element that can be added to a chat interface. It comprises of properties like button text and a flag indicating whether the button should be disabled after interaction.

docs.title: Card Bubble
docs.description: The CometChatCardBubble component is used to display a card within a chat bubble. The card includes an image, text, and action buttons. It helps to offer action-oriented chat experiences, like booking a flight, ordering food, scheduling a meeting, etc., directly in the chat.

docs.title: Form Bubble
docs.description: The CometChatFormBubble component is used to render a form within a chat bubble. The form fields are dynamically built based on the data passed in the message prop. The form fields can include text inputs, checkboxes, radio buttons, dropdown, labels, single selects, buttons. Once the form is filled out and submitted, the data will be sent to the provided URL or handled by a custom function.

docs.title: Confirm Dialog

docs.title: Date

docs.title: Emoji Keyboard

The value of subtitle is also optional, will occupy the space allocated for an additional line of text or some other widget.

docs.title: Message Bubble Styling
docs.description: When building chat applications, customizing the look and feel of message bubbles is often a significant challenge. Developers frequently encounter difficulties when they need to modify specific design elements, such as background colors or styles for particular message types. This complexity is amplified by the wide range of message bubbles available in the CometChat Flutter UI Kit.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.description: CometChat's theming framework is a robust system that empowers developers to define the look and feel of their applications with precision and consistency. It follows three essential design system principles: Color, Typography, and Shape. These principles guide the customization of various UI components.

docs.title: ActionItem
docs.description: CometChatActionItem is a pre-defined structure for creating action that can be used to perform an action such as a button click or navigating a link.

docs.title: ActionsIcon
docs.description: CometChatActionsIcon is a pre-defined structure for creating actions that the user can perform on a message with an icon representation.

docs.title: ActionsView
docs.description: CometChatActionsView is a pre-defined structure for creating actions that the user can perform on a message with a customised UI view representation.

docs.title: DetailsOption
docs.description: CometChatDetailsOption is a pre-defined structure for creating option within a DetailsTemplate in the CometChatDetails component.

docs.title: DetailsTemplate
docs.description: CometChatDetailsTemplate is a pre-defined structure for creating a template data for the CometChatDetails component.

docs.title: MessageComposerAction
docs.description: CometChatMessageComposerAction is a pre-defined structure for creating an attachment option in the CometChatMessageComposer component that the user can perform in addition to composing a message.

docs.title: MessageTemplate
docs.description: CometChatMessageTemplate is a pre-defined structure for creating message views that can be used as a starting point or blueprint for creating message views, often known as message bubbles. These views appear in the message list view and render the messages of that particular chat or conversation. It allows developers to define standard message viewing formats that can be reused or customised for different use cases, or even add new ones for their own purposes.

docs.title: Option
docs.description: CometChatOption is a pre-defined structure for creating an option that can be used to perform an action message such as edit, delete etc.

docs.title: TabItem
docs.description: CometChatTabItem is a pre-defined structure for creating a tab item that can be part of tabbed interface.

docs.title: UIKitSettings
docs.description: UIKitSettings is pre-defined structure containing credentials required to initialise CometChat SDK.

docs.title: AuxiliaryButtonAlignment
docs.description: AuxiliaryButtonAlignment describes the positioning of auxiliary buttons in CometChatMessageComposer component.

docs.title: DatePatterns
docs.description: DatePatterns describes a specific format or arrangement used to represent dates in a human-readable form.

docs.title: DocumentIconAlignment
docs.description: DocumentIconAlignment describes the positioning of icon within the CometChatDocumentBubble component.

docs.title: HTTPSRequestMethods
docs.description: HTTPSRequestMethods lists the HTTP methods for API requests.

docs.title: IconButtonAlignment
docs.description: IconButtonAlignment describes the positioning of icon within the CometChatIconButton component.

docs.title: LabelAlignment
docs.description: LabelAlignment is used to align the label for web elements.

docs.title: MessageBubbleAlignment
docs.description: MessageBubbleAlignment describes the positioning of the message bubble.

docs.title: MessageListAlignment
docs.description: MessageListAlignment describes the positioning or arrangement of message bubbles in the component

docs.title: TimestampAlignment
docs.description: TimestampAlignment described the positioning or arrangement of timestamp for each message bubble in the component

docs.title: Calls Events
docs.description: CometChatCallEvents emits events when the logged-in user executes some action on a call object.

docs.description: CometChatConversationEvents emits events when the logged-in user executes some action on a conversation object.

docs.title: UI Events
docs.description: UI events, refer to actions or interactions performed by a user within the CometChat's UI Kit. These events are triggered when a user interacts with various UI elements, such as buttons, menus, checkboxes, input fields, or any other interactive components.

docs.title: Users Events
docs.description: CometChatUserEvents emits events when the logged-in user executes some action on an user object.

docs.title: Action Entity
docs.description: Base class for defining the type of actions that can be performed on BaseInteractiveElement

docs.title: Button Element
docs.description: The ButtonElement class, inherited from the BaseInteractiveElement class, represents an interactive button element that can be added to a chat interface. It comprises of properties like button text and a flag indicating whether the button should be disabled after interaction.

docs.title: Card Bubble
docs.description: The CometChatCardBubble component is used to display a card within a chat bubble. The card includes an image, text, and action buttons. It helps to offer action-oriented chat experiences, like booking a flight, ordering food, scheduling a meeting, etc., directly in the chat.

docs.title: Card Message
docs.description: The CardMessage class is used to create a card message for CometChat. It extends the InteractiveMessage class from CometChat.

docs.title: Checkbox Element
docs.description: The CheckboxElement class aids in creating checkbox input elements in a user interface.

docs.title: SchedulerBubble
docs.description: SchedulerBubble is a versatile type of component designed to facilitate easy and efficient event scheduling. It offers the following key features:

docs.title: Custom Interactive Message
docs.description: The CustomInteractiveMessage class extends CometChat's InteractiveMessage class and represents a custom interactive message that can be sent via CometChat.

docs.title: DateTimePickerElement
docs.description: The DateTimePickerElement class is used to create a Date Picker element in a user interface.

docs.title: DropdownElement
docs.description: The DropdownElement class is used to create a dropdown selection element in a user interface.

docs.title: Element Type
docs.description: This is the base class for every element possible in the Interactive message component, defined by CometChat

docs.title: Form Bubble
docs.description: The CometChatFormBubble component is used to render a form within a chat bubble. The form fields are dynamically built based on the data passed in the message prop. The form fields can include text inputs, checkboxes, radio buttons, dropdown, labels, single selects, buttons. Once the form is filled out and submitted, the data will be sent to the provided URL or handled by a custom function.

docs.title: Form Message
docs.description: The FormMessage class is used to create an interactive form message that can be sent via CometChat. It extends the InteractiveMessage class from CometChat.

docs.title: Label Element
docs.description: The LabelElement class enables the creation of a label element in a user interface.

docs.title: Radio Button Element
docs.description: The RadioButtonElement class is designed to create a radio button input element in a user interface.

docs.title: Scheduler Message
docs.description: The SchedulerMessage class is used to create an interactive scheduler message that can be sent via CometChat. It extends the Interactive Messages class from CometChat.

docs.title: Single Select Element
docs.description: The SingleSelectElement  class is utilised to create a single selection input element in a user interface.

docs.title: Text Input Element
docs.description: The TextInputElement class is used to create a text input element in a user interface.

docs.title: Overview
docs.description: This is a collection of utility functions and constants for building chat UI components with CometChat's web UIKits. This is created and published as a dependency of all our web UIKits.

docs.title: Localize
docs.description: With language localization, CometChat UI Kit adapts to the language of a specific country or region. CometChatLocalize allows you to detect the language of your users based on their browser settings and set the language accordingly.

docs.title: Sound Manager
docs.description: CometChatSoundManager provides functionalities for managing audio playback for incoming / outgoing messages in 1:1 or group chat.

docs.title: ReactionInfo
docs.description: The CometChatReactionInfo component is used to display the count and users of a specific reaction to a message.

docs.title: ReactionList
docs.description: The CometChatReactionList component is used to manage and display reactions in messages. It provides functionalities like fetching reactions when a message is updated, updating the reactions, and observing when the user has scrolled to the end of the reaction list.

docs.title: Reactions
docs.description: The CometChatReactions component is used to display a list of reactions to a specific message. Users can see who has reacted to the message and with what emoji.

docs.title: Action sheet
docs.description: This element is a slide-up pane for presenting the user with a set of actions.

docs.title: Audio bubble
docs.description: This element handles the display and the play/pause functionality for an individual audio. This element uses the native embed audio element.

docs.title: Avatar
docs.description: This element is used to represent a CometChat.User of CometChat.group profile picture with fallback to the initials.

docs.title: Backdrop
docs.description: This element represents the background against which other elements are presented.

docs.title: Badge
docs.description: This element is a numeric value descriptor i.e it displays the unread count of messages for 1-1/group chats.

docs.title: Button Group
docs.description: This element is grouping of buttons together in a single line.

docs.title: Checkbox
docs.description: This element allow the user to select one or more items from a set.

docs.title: QuickView
docs.description: CometChat's Quick View component allows you to create a quick overview panel with a title, subtitle, and an optional close button. It extends from the LitElement's base class.

docs.title: Confirm dialog
docs.description: This element is a type of modal window that appears in front of app content to ask for a decision. It require users to explicitly confirm their choice before an option is committed.

docs.title: Date
docs.description: This element displays the date with the in-built support of 3 date patterns.

docs.title: Document bubble
docs.description: This element is a card view consisting of title, subtitle, url, icon and a launch button.

docs.title: Dropdown
docs.description: This element is a stylised version of the select component. It allows the user to select one option from a list.

docs.title: Emoji Keyboard
docs.description: This element is CometChat's very own emoji picker with native emoji support.

docs.title: File bubble
docs.description: This element handles the display and the download functionality for an individual file.

docs.title: Icon
docs.description: This element displays an icon. It currently supports only svg icons

docs.title: Icon Button
docs.description: This element uses Icon element and Label element to show text and icon(with background) and along with an alignment property to align the icon around the text. The purpose of this element is to initiate an action.

docs.title: Image bubble
docs.description: This element handles the display for an individual image.

docs.title: Input
docs.description: This element allows users to enter or provide data or information within a web form or interface. It is one of the fundamental building blocks for user input and interaction on websites and web applications.

docs.title: Label
docs.description: This element provides descriptive information about the associated UI element.

docs.title: List item
docs.description: This element is used to display rows of information, such as a contact list, playlist, or menu. They contain Avatar, Status indicator, title, subtitle, tailView and menuView.

docs.title: Loader
docs.description: This element helps to notify users that loading is underway. They are used while retrieving data or performing slow computations.

docs.title: Media Recorder
docs.description: This element allows users to record voice and send them as audio  messages. It has a start button to start recording, a stop button to stop recording, a play button to play the recorded message, a submit button to submit the recorded message and a close button to close the media recorder.

docs.title: Message Input
docs.description: This element enable users to enter free-form text data along with  custom view of 3 variants (primary, secondary and auxiliary).

docs.title: Modal
docs.description: This element renders its children component in front of the backdrop element.

docs.title: Overview
docs.description: Elements is a set of pre-built UI components that act as building blocks of our UI Kit. These UI components are built following the web components standard and using lit library. This allows us to create a framework-agnostic solution so that they can be integrated with our web UIKits such as React, Angular and Vue.

docs.title: Popover
docs.description: This element displays additional content or options in a small, overlay-like window. It appears on top of the current screen without requiring the user to navigate to a different page or screen.

docs.title: Radio button
docs.description: This element allows the user to exactly select one item from a set.

docs.title: Receipt
docs.description: This element renders the read receipts such as sending, sent, delivered and error state indicator of a sent message.

docs.title: Search Input
docs.description: This element is built on top of Input element and enables users to enter a search string.

docs.title: SingleSelect
docs.description: The CometChatSingleSelect  component is a customizable Single Select component that allows you to choose one option from a list of box-structured options. It extends from the LitElement's base class.

docs.title: Status Indicator
docs.description: This element shows the user presence as dots with colored background and group type  as dots with background images.

docs.title: Text bubble
docs.description: This element handles the display for an individual text message.

docs.title: Text Input
docs.description: This element enable users to enter free-form text data along with  custom view of 3 variants (primary, secondary and auxiliary).

docs.title: Video bubble
docs.description: This element handles the display and the play/pause functionality for an individual video. This element uses the native embed video element.

docs.title: Messaging

docs.title: Interactive Messages
docs.description: An InteractiveMessage is a specialised object that encapsulates an interactive unit within a chat message, such as an embedded form that users can fill out directly within the chat interface. This enhances user engagement by making the chat experience more interactive and responsive to user input.

docs.title: Mentions
docs.description: Mentions in messages enable users to refer to specific individual within a conversation. This is done by using the ` format, where UID` represents the user’s unique identification.

docs.title: Reactions
docs.description: Enhance user engagement in your chat application with message reactions. Users can express their emotions using reactions to messages. This feature allows users to add or remove reactions, and to fetch all reactions on a message. You can also listen to reaction events in real-time. Let's see how to work with reactions in CometChat's SDK.

docs.title: Transient Messages
docs.description: Transient messages are messages that are sent in real-time only and are not saved or tracked anywhere. The receiver of the message will only receive the message if he is online and these messages cannot be retrieved later.

docs.title: Bots
docs.description: Bots are special users, in CometChat, who can send and receive messages autonomously. Users can text bots privately in one-on-one conversations as well as in groups. When a bot receives a message, either in a one-on-one conversation or in a group conversation, CometChat forwards the message to a Callback URL that you specify. Once you receive this message, you can send a reply using our API.

docs.description: In iOS, when the user enters in the background state, real time connection breaks with the server. docs.title: Bots
docs.description: Bots are special users, in CometChat, who can send and receive messages autonomously. Users can text bots privately in one-on-one conversations as well as in groups. When a bot receives a message, either in a one-on-one conversation or in a group conversation, CometChat forwards the message to a Callback URL that you specify. Once you receive this message, you can send a reply using our API.

docs.title: Prepare your app for background updates
docs.description: In iOS, when the user enters in the background state, real time connection breaks with the server. So, if the user comes inside the chat window or in the conversation list then it won't update the new messages received from the real time server until it's being fetched from the API.

docs.title: Bots
docs.description: Bots are special users, in CometChat, who can send and receive messages autonomously. Users can text bots privately in one-on-one conversations as well as in groups. When a bot receives a message, either in a one-on-one conversation or in a group conversation, CometChat forwards the message to a Callback URL that you specify. Once you receive this message, you can send a reply using our API.

docs.title: Interactive Messages
docs.description: An InteractiveMessage is a specialized object that encapsulates an interactive unit within a chat message, such as an embedded form that users can fill out directly within the chat interface. This enhances user engagement by making the chat experience more interactive and responsive to user input.

docs.title: Transient Messages
docs.description: Transient messages are messages that are sent in real-time only and are not saved or tracked anywhere. The receiver of the message will only receive the message if he is online and these messages cannot be retrieved later.

docs.title: Delivery & Read Receipts
docs.description: Mark Messages as Delivered

docs.title: Mentions
docs.description: Mentions in messages enable users to refer to specific individual within a conversation. This is done by using the ` format, where UID` represents the user’s unique identification.

docs.title: Reactions
docs.description: Enhance user engagement in your chat application with message reactions. Users can express their emotions using reactions to messages. This feature allows users to add or remove reactions, and to fetch all reactions on a message. You can also listen to reaction events in real-time. Let's see how to work with reactions in CometChat's SDK.

docs.title: Bots
docs.description: Bots are special users, in CometChat, who can send and receive messages autonomously. Users can text bots privately in one-on-one conversations as well as in groups. When a bot receives a message, either in a one-on-one conversation or in a group conversation, CometChat forwards the message to a Callback URL that you specify. Once you receive this message, you can send a reply using our API.

docs.title: Interactive Messages
docs.description: An InteractiveMessage is a specialised object that encapsulates an interactive unit within a chat message, such as an embedded form that users can fill out directly within the chat interface. This enhances user engagement by making the chat experience more interactive and responsive to user input.

docs.title: Transient Messages
docs.description: Transient messages are messages that are sent in real-time only and are not saved or tracked anywhere. The receiver of the message will only receive the message if he is online and these messages cannot be retrieved later.

docs.title: Mentions
docs.description: Mentions in messages enable users to refer to specific individual within a conversation. This is done by using the ` format, where UID` represents the user’s unique identification.

docs.title: Reactions
docs.description: Enhance user engagement in your chat application with message reactions. Users can express their emotions using reactions to messages. This feature allows users to add or remove reactions, and to fetch all reactions on a message. You can also listen to reaction events in real-time. Let's see how to work with reactions in CometChat's SDK.

docs.description: The Disappearing Messages extension allows end-users to send messages that disappear after a certain interval of time. This extension works for both private (one-on-one) and group messages.

docs.description: GIFs are a great way to change the tone or convey emotions in your conversations. Here's a guide which helps to implement Gifphy in an easy and quick way. Let's get started!

docs.title: Gfycat (Deprecated)

docs.title: Reminders

docs.title: Smart Replies
docs.description: The Smart Reply extension allows you to show quick reply options to a user so that they can easily respond to a message. We will always suggest 3 options; one positive, one neutral and one negative. We also add a category, in case you want to skip some suggestions.

docs.title: Message Translation
docs.description: The Message Translation extension helps you translate messages into multiple languages.

docs.title: Emojis (Deprecated)
docs.description: This extension is outdated as all the major browsers natively support emojis.

docs.title: Polls
docs.description: Polls let you quickly record the opinions directly in the Conversations and also view the results.

docs.title: Reactions
docs.description: Reactions are the ability to react to an individual message with a specific emotion, quickly showing acknowledgment or expressing how you feel in a lightweight way.

docs.id: Data import and migration/Live data migration/index
docs.title: Live data migration
docs.description: Upon integrating with our messaging solution, you may encounter a scenario where your application is transitioning from a homegrown chat feature to our comprehensive services. During this transition phase, a live migration process is necessary to ensure continuity of communication.

docs.title: Overview
docs.description: Data import and migration, in the context of CometChat, involves transferring your existing chat-related data from your own servers or another chat service provider to the CometChat platform. This process typically encompasses the migration of users, their messages, any chat groups, and the list of members within those groups. The goal of migration is to ensure a seamless transition and continuity of the chat service for your users.

docs.title: Overview
docs.description: The Moderation feature provides a comprehensive suite of capabilities designed to manage and enforce message moderation rules across various types of messages, ensuring your platform remains safe and compliant for all users. These capabilities include rule management for creating, updating, and deleting moderation rules, as well as keyword lists for detecting inappropriate content. Additionally, automated actions promptly address potential violations, and detailed reports on blocked messages help to continuously improve safety and compliance measures. By leveraging these robust functionalities, you can effectively maintain a secure and welcoming environment on your platform.
